conclusion: Analyze the motion of the charged particle in both the magnetic and electric fields.
The particle is injected from the origin O with a velocity at a 45° angle to the y-axis.
The velocity components are v_x = v_0 cos(45°) = v_0/√2 and v_y = v_0 sin(45°) = v_0/√2.
The magnetic field is perpendicular to the plane and points inward (into the page).
The force on the particle is given by F = q(v × B), causing the particle to move in a circular path.
The radius r of the circular path is given by r = mv/qB, where v = v_0/√2.
The time taken to complete a quarter circle is t_1 = πr/(2v).
The electric field is directed along the negative y-axis.
The force on the particle is F = qE, causing a deceleration in the y-direction.
The x-component of velocity remains constant: v_x = v_0/√2.
The y-component of velocity decreases due to the electric field: v_y = v_0/√2 - at, where a = qE/m.
The particle reaches point P(3L, L) when x = 3L and y = L.
The time taken to travel in the x-direction is t_2 = 3L√2/v_0.
At point P, the velocity is directed along the positive x-axis, so v_y = 0, giving t_2 = v_0/(a√2).
The total time is the sum of the time in the magnetic field and the time in the electric field: t_total = t_1 + t_2.
Substitute values: t_1 = πm/(2qB√2) and t_2 = 3L√2/v_0.
The total time taken for the particle to move from point O to point P is t_total = πm/(2qB√2) + 3L√2/v_0.
